newsitem.title: POLAND: ComputerLand issues for mergers cleared.
newsitem.headline: ComputerLand issues for mergers cleared.

text.p: The Polish Securities Commission (KPW) approved for public trade three issues of registered common shares by software firm ComputerLand SA, KPW head Jacek Socha told a news conference on Thursday.

The issues consist of 58,163 shares for network integrator Info-Serwis Ltd, 472,236 to 545,762 shares for programmer Computer System for Business International SA (CSBI) and 119,335 shares for ComputerLand Europe Operations SA.
ComputerLand will in turn absorb Info-Serwis and make it the northeastern base of its operations and add CSBI to its group by taking over 76.24 percent to 88.11 percent of its shares.
In exchange for the 119,335 shares for ComputerLand Europe Operations SA, ComputerLand will receive the right to use the company's name and logo.
Subscriptions for all three issues are due next month. -- Warsaw Newsroom +48 22 653 9700
